page.title: 15HARGRAVE HALL
page.content: HARGRAVE HALL is where a company called WARD WHITE (of Rushden) has its offices. Most of their interests are in the shoe and leather trade. Several people from the village are employed to work at the hall. HARGRAVE HALL was a restaurant before WARD WHITE bought it in the early 1980's. Before that it had always been used as a family home. It was built in the 19th Century by Lewis Baker. He sold it to a man called Lewis Holt, who later sold it to Sir Kenneth and Lady Murchison. In 1949 it was sold to Mr & Mrs Pedley who lived there until 1959. Since then it has been owned by a number of families - The Stobarts, Botterills, Johnsons and finally The Deranoys, who then sold it to WARD WHITE.
